definitions.definition: Something which clips or grasps; a device for attaching one object to another.
definitions.example: Use this clip to attach the check to your tax form.

definitions.definition: An unspecified but normally understood as rapid speed or pace.
definitions.example: He was walking at a fair clip and I was out of breath trying to keep up.

definitions.definition: An embrace.
A frame containing a number of bullets which is intended to be inserted into the magazine of a firearm to allow for rapid reloading.
A projecting flange on the upper edge of a horseshoe, turned up so as to embrace the lower part of the hoof; a toe clip or beak.
A gaff or hook for landing the fish, as in salmon fishing.
To grip tightly.
To fasten with a clip.
definitions.example: Please clip the photos to the pages where they will go.

definitions.definition: To hug, embrace.
To collect signatures, generally with the use of a clipboard.
Something which has been clipped from a larger whole:
An act of clipping, such as a haircut.
definitions.example: I went into the salon to get a clip.

definitions.definition: The condition of something, its state.
definitions.example: Deeky the clip of that aad wife ower thor!

definitions.definition: A blow with the hand (often in the set phrase clip round the ear)
definitions.example: Give him a clip round the ear!

definitions.definition: To cut, especially with scissors or shears as opposed to a knife etc.
definitions.example: Please clip that coupon out of the newspaper.

definitions.definition: To curtail; to cut short.
To strike with the hand.
definitions.example: I'll clip ye round the lugs!

definitions.definition: To hit or strike, especially in passing.
definitions.example: The car skidded off the road and clipped a lamppost.

definitions.definition: An illegal tackle: Throwing the body across the back of an opponent's leg or hitting him from the back below the waist while moving up from behind unless the opponent is a runner or the action is in close line play.
To cut off a signal level at a certain maximum value.
To discard (an occluded part of a model or scene) rather than waste resources on rendering it.
(Of a camera, character model, etc.) To move (through or into) (a rendered object or barrier).
definitions.example: Clipping through walls is integral to the game's speedruns.

definitions.definition: To cheat, swindle, or fleece.
To grab or take stealthily
